content:
Define a module named TopModule with the specified interface including inputs clk, reset, and d (8 bits), and output q (8 bits).

Retrieved Related Information:
- clk: input clock signal (Type:Signal)
- reset: input reset signal, active high (Type:Signal)
- d: 8-bit input data (Type:Signal)
- q: 8-bit output data (Type:Signal)
- On the negative edge of clk, if reset is high, all D flip-flops are set to 0x34. (Type:StateTransition)
- On the negative edge of clk, if reset is low, the value of d is loaded into the flip-flops. (Type:StateTransition)
source: Implement a module named TopModule with the following interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise specified.

content:
Implement 8 D flip-flops inside the TopModule. Each flip-flop should capture the corresponding bit of input d on the negative edge of clk.

Retrieved Related Information:
- clk: input clock signal (Type:Signal)
- d: 8-bit input data (Type:Signal)
- q: 8-bit output data (Type:Signal)
- On the negative edge of clk, if reset is high, all D flip-flops are set to 0x34. (Type:StateTransition)
- On the negative edge of clk, if reset is low, the value of d is loaded into the flip-flops. (Type:StateTransition)
source: All DFFs should be triggered by the negative edge of clk.

content:
Add synchronous reset functionality to each D flip-flop. When reset is high, each flip-flop should be set to the corresponding bit of the value 0x34.

Retrieved Related Information:
- reset: input reset signal, active high (Type:Signal)
- On the negative edge of clk, if reset is high, all D flip-flops are set to 0x34. (Type:StateTransition)
source: The flip-flops must be reset to 0x34 rather than zero.
